meanings.sent1: The museum displayed several ectypes of famous paintings.
meanings.sent2: The artist created an ectype of the original sculpture.
meanings.sent3: The ectype of the book cover had a funny typo.
meanings.sent4: Her drawing was like an ectype of a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The ectype of the document was blurry and hard to read.

meanings.sent1: The movie was an ectype of the popular novel.
meanings.sent2: The ectype of the song had a different melody.
meanings.sent3: The ectype of the recipe used a unique ingredient.
meanings.sent4: His speech felt like an ectype of someone else's ideas.
meanings.sent5: The ectype of the logo was slightly altered for the new product.

meanings.definition: A representation or image of something else
meanings.sent1: The mirror acted as an ectype of her reflection.
meanings.sent2: The ectype of the map showed all the hiking trails.
meanings.sent3: The ectype of the character in the play wore a funny hat.
meanings.sent4: His painting was an ectype of the beautiful landscape.
meanings.sent5: The ectype of the sculpture captured every detail perfectly.
